text: [Music]
hey guys
angel here I hope you guys are having a
great summer like I am one of the things
I wanted to show you today is how to
make a summer salad using Taiwanese
cabbage yes you can eat Taiwanese
cabbage raw now if you guys aren't
familiar with Taiwanese cabbage you've
probably had it if you've had steamed
buns it's a really popular steamed bun
filling and you've probably more common
we've had it as a stir-fry makes a great
vegetable stir-fry with garlic but today
I'm going to show you how to make
Taiwanese cabbage in a salad which is
slightly mild tasting and it's also very
crunchy which is really nice so if
you're interested in the new summer
salad recipe using Taiwanese cabbage
keep watching for the salad we'll need
one Taiwanese cabbage some whole kernel
corn English cucumber and some green
onions for garnish for the dressing is
going to be super simple two ingredients
black sesame oil which you can get from
your local Asian grocery store and
garlic salt the one I'm using is just a
blend of sea salt and organic garlic
next besides how much salad you want to
make I'm going to cut and use about a
quarter of my Taiwanese cabbage which
should feed about three to four people
family style
remove and discard the outermost leaves
and then start to hand care the cabbage
into smaller bite-sized pieces
I find that hand-carrying Taiwanese
cabbage makes for more consistent
looking pieces plus it's kind of fun too
after you're done hand tearing make sure
to give the cabbage is good rinse under
cold water and if you have a salad
spinner here go ahead and use that but
if you don't that's okay just transfer
the greens to a large salad or mixing
bowl and use some paper towels to gently
absorb any excess water now let's
prepare the rest of the fresh
ingredients slice some English cucumbers
and some green onions add those all in
then a few spoonfuls of sweet whole
kernel corn finally to top it all off
add in three to four tablespoons of
sesame oil and it's totally okay to
eyeball it here just as you would olive
oil in a dressing and add a good amount
of garlic salt not too much so it's too
salty but enough so you can taste the
garlic I promise you it'll taste really
good
a good mix and because everyone's
preferences are different stuff to do a
taste test once you're happy with the
amount of sesame oil and garlic salt
serve the salad family-style in the
mixing bowl or transfer to smaller
serving bowls for a nice salad appetizer
[Music]
so that's how you make a Taiwanese
cabbage summer salad as you can see it
was super easy to make and you can
definitely make a big batch for potlucks
and family gatherings kamini sums up if
you liked the video and also don't
forget to subscribe to my youtube
channel
angel Long's kitchen if you haven't
already and I just want to say quick
thanks to all of you who's complimenting
me on my haircut in my last video and
also Sarina D who would ask for me to
bring back to taste-test
so I'm going to do a quick taste test I
know some of you like to see the initial
reactions of what stew tastes like so
here goes so I don't know if you could
hear that but it was super crunchy the
texture is great for a salad it's mildly
sweet I love the flavors of the sesame
oil dressing also with that garlic salt
and my garlic salt there is so much
garlic flavor and I love garlic so
definitely have garlic bath afterwards
but worth it you guys are definitely
gonna love this recipe so if you try it
come back post and let me know in the
comments below how you liked it or tag
me on social media I love seeing your
recipe remix until then take care and I
will see you in the next one hi
